body_html: It looks like that code was written for an older version of TensorFlow. From TensorFlow 1.0 onwards, tf.concat() takes the arguments values and axis. Replacing concat_dim with axis will fix the problem.
body_text: It looks like that code was written for an older version of TensorFlow. From TensorFlow 1.0 onwards, tf.concat() takes the arguments values and axis. Replacing concat_dim with axis will fix the problem.
body: It looks like that code was written for an older version of TensorFlow. From TensorFlow 1.0 onwards, [`tf.concat()`](https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r1.0/api_docs/python/tf/concat) takes the arguments `values` and `axis`. Replacing `concat_dim` with `axis` will fix the problem.
